QueryAllFeatures(url, sql, out_fields='*', chunksize=1000, saveLocation='', outName='')¶
RemoveAndAddFeatures(url, pathToFeatureClass, id_field, chunksize=1000)¶

removes features from a feature service and appends the features from a feature class

Parameters:
  • url (str) – The URL of the feature service.
  • pathToFeatureClass (str) – The absolute path to the feature class.
  • id_field (str) – Field name used for chunking.
  • chunksize (Optional [int]) – Chunking value to divide input feature class in parts. Defaults to 1000.
Raises:
  • ArcRestHelperError – If arcpy not found, FC does not exist, or field does not exist.
  • ValueError – If chunksize is < 1 or is not an integer.

Examples

>>> url = "http://services.arcgis.com/<random>/arcgis/rest/services/test/FeatureServer/x"
>>> fst.RemoveAndAddFeatures(url, "C:/test.gdb/x", "PARCELID", 500)

arcresthelper.resettools module¶

class arcresthelper.resettools.resetTools(securityinfo)¶

Bases: arcresthelper.securityhandlerhelper.securityhandlerhelper

removeUserData(users=None)¶

This function deletes content for the list of users, if no users are specified, all users in the org are queried and their content is deleted.

Inputs: users - Comma delimited list of user names

removeUserGroups(users=None)¶

This function deletes all groups for the list of users, if no users are specified, all users in the org are queried and their groups is deleted.

Inputs: users - Comma delimted list of user names

arcresthelper.securityhandlerhelper module¶

arcresthelper.securityhandlerhelper.lineno()¶

Returns the current line number in our program.

class arcresthelper.securityhandlerhelper.securityhandlerhelper(securityinfo)¶

Bases: object

A number of different security handlers are suppoted by ArcGIS, this function simplifies the creation of the handlers. A dict with the type of handler and information to created it is required to generate the handlers

dispose()¶
message¶

returns any messages

securityhandler¶

returns the security hanlder

valid¶

returns boolean wether handler is valid

arcresthelper.securityhandlerhelper.trace()¶

trace finds the line, the filename and error message and returns it to the user
